title: Here's everything coming to Hulu in March 2022 — and what's leaving
text:
Amanda Seyfried stars in one of the month's most anticipated new offerings — the Elizabeth Holmes bio-series “The Dropout” (March 3), exploring the scandalous true story of Theranos and its mercurial founder, who was found guilty earlier this year on four counts of fraud and conspiracy.

Other originals include “Life & Beth” (March 18), a new comedy series starring Amy Schumer as a woman shaking up her comfortable life after a sudden incident makes her rethink everything; and a pair of movies, “Fresh” (March 4), a cannibal rom-com/thriller starring Sebastian Stan and Daisy Edgar-Jones; and “Deep Water” (March 18), an erotic thriller starring Ben Affleck and Ana de Armas.

What to watch?Get more monthly picks at What's Worth Streaming

The Disney DIS-controlled streaming service also has Season 5 of Pamela Adlon's excellent single-mother comedy “Better Things” (March 1); the long, long, long-awaited third season of Donald Glover's transcendent comedy series “Atlanta” (March 25); and Season 2 of John Hodgman's animated detective comedy “Dicktown” (March 4) — note that all three will stream a day after new episodes air on FX.

There are also the premieres of network shows like NBC's crime miniseries “The Thing About Pam” (March 9), starring Renée Zellweger; Fox's “The Masked Singer” (March 10); the new Fox sitcom “Welcome to Flatch” (March 18); and “American Song Contest” (March 22), NBC's answer to the Eurovision Song Contest.

Hulu is also adding a ton of good movies, including “Blue Velvet,” “Drinking Buddies,” “L.A. Confidential,” “The Royal Tennenbaums” and “The Talented Mr. Ripley” (all March 1).

Here's the complete list of what's coming and going in March, as of Feb. 17 (release dates are subject to change):
